column4: sudo apt-get install kvm         and load its module       sudo modprobe kvm             and use an emulator like qemu to fully utilise its potential
does it have virtualization extentions in it?
if not, using kvm (the module) is pointless
i have an E4500 that lacks the commands too. the kvm module wont load
cat /proc/cpuinfo               take a close look at the flags setion. no vtx (since its intel) = no kvm module
there is a line starting with flags right?

flags  : fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush dts acpi mmx fxsr sse sse2 ss ht tm pbe nx lm constant_tsc arch_perfmon pebs bts pni monitor ds_cpl est tm2 ssse3 cx16 xtpr lahf_lm
does it say vtx anywhere across that line?
well you can always install the module, try loading it and if no vtx, it wont load the module
Things i want to do is to  practice network commands as in real time?
